Comment: This is Cordel Defence to Ruy Lopez, a rare choice for black. The most usual line of play for Black is 3...a6 4. Ba4 b5 5. Bb3 Nf6 6. O-O Be7 7. c3 Na5 ....

White wastes no time to gain advantage by attacking the center and trying to take control of central squares as quickly as possible and push black backwards and force him to place his his pieces on bad squares, and thus cutting off the coordination of enemy troops.
The knight heads for a strong outpost at c4 where it will be able to counter Black's queenside play and put pressure on the key squares of e5 and d6.

A normal looking move to develop the Queen, but delaying the King's safety is an error. White makes use of Black's lapse and gathers attacking resources while keeping Black busy on the defence of his pieces.
